I have gathered enough information about the project structure. Let me now provide a comprehensive implementation plan for the AI virtual try-on (clothing swap) application.

---

# AI Virtual Try-On Application - Complete Implementation Plan

## Executive Summary

This plan outlines the implementation of an AI-powered virtual clothing try-on application built with React 18, Vite, TypeScript, shadcn/ui, and Supabase. The application allows users to upload their photos and virtually try on clothes from a pre-defined garment library using AI processing.

---

## 1. Product Functionality Modules

### 1.1 Welcome/Landing Page
- **Hero section** with animated gradient background
- **Feature highlights** showcasing the app's capabilities
- **Call-to-action button** to start the try-on experience
- **Sample results gallery** to demonstrate quality

### 1.2 Photo Upload Module
- **Drag-and-drop upload zone** with visual feedback
- **Camera capture option** (using browser's getUserMedia API)
- **Image preview** with cropping/adjustment capabilities
- **Image validation** (format, size, resolution checks)
- **Upload progress indicator**

### 1.3 Garment Selection Module
- **Category-based browsing** (tops, bottoms, dresses, outerwear)
- **Grid gallery view** with garment thumbnails
- **Carousel for featured items**
- **Filter and search** functionality
- **Garment detail preview** on hover/click

### 1.4 AI Processing Module
- **Processing status display** with animated progress
- **Estimated time indicator**
- **Error handling** with retry options
- **Queue management** for multiple requests

### 1.5 Results Display Module
- **Before/after comparison slider**
- **Download option** for generated images
- **Share functionality**
- **Try another garment** quick action
- **Quality rating feedback**

### 1.6 History Module (Optional)
- **Session-based history** (no authentication required)
- **Persistent history** (with Supabase authentication)
- **Re-try previous combinations**
- **Delete history entries**

---

## 2. User Interaction Flow

```
[Landing Page]
      |
      v
[Upload Photo] --> [Validate Image] --> [Error: Re-upload]
      |
      v
[Select Garment] --> [Browse Categories] --> [Select Item]
      |
      v
[Confirm Selection] --> [Preview Both Images]
      |
      v
[Process with AI] --> [Show Progress] --> [Handle Errors/Retry]
      |
      v
[Display Result] --> [Download/Share/Try Another]
      |
      v
[History (Optional)] --> [View Past Results]
```

### Detailed Flow Steps:

1. **Entry**: User lands on the welcome page with animated gradient background
2. **Initiation**: User clicks "Start Try-On" button
3. **Photo Upload**: 
   - User drags and drops or clicks to select a photo
   - System validates the image (human figure, proper resolution)
   - Preview shown with optional cropping
4. **Garment Selection**:
   - User browses through garment categories
   - User selects a garment to try on
   - System shows preview of both images side by side
5. **Processing**:
   - User confirms and initiates AI processing
   - Progress indicator shows estimated time
   - System calls Supabase Edge Function which calls AI API
6. **Result**:
   - Generated image displayed with comparison slider
   - User can download, share, or try another garment
7. **History** (if implemented):
   - Results saved to Supabase storage
   - User can view and manage past try-ons

---

## 3. AI Service Recommendation

### Primary Recommendation: Replicate - IDM-VTON

**Model**: `cuuupid/idm-vton` on Replicate

**Why IDM-VTON:**
- State-of-the-art virtual try-on quality
- Supports various clothing types
- Good balance of speed and quality
- Pay-per-use pricing model
- Easy API integration

**API Call Structure:**
```typescript
// Replicate API endpoint
const prediction = await replicate.predictions.create({
  version: "c871bb9b046c1b1-...", // IDM-VTON version
  input: {
    human_img: userPhotoUrl,      // URL to user's uploaded photo
    garm_img: garmentImageUrl,    // URL to garment image
    category: "upper_body",        // Category type
    // Additional parameters for quality tuning
  }
});
```

**Cost Estimation:**
- Approximately $0.02-0.05 per generation
- ~30-60 seconds processing time

### Alternative Options:

1. **Kolors Virtual Try-On (Replicate)**
   - Model: `kolors/virtual-tryon`
   - Good for fashion-forward results

2. **Fashn.AI API**
   - Commercial solution with dedicated support
   - Higher cost but better SLA

3. **Self-hosted Solution**
   - Deploy open-source models on own infrastructure
   - Higher upfront cost, lower per-request cost

---

## 4. Data Storage Architecture (Supabase)

### 4.1 Database Schema

```sql
-- Users table (optional, for authenticated experience)
CREATE TABLE users (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  email TEXT UNIQUE,
  created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Garments table (pre-loaded clothing library)
CREATE TABLE garments (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  name TEXT NOT NULL,
  category TEXT NOT NULL, -- 'tops', 'bottoms', 'dresses', 'outerwear'
  image_url TEXT NOT NULL,
  thumbnail_url TEXT,
  is_featured BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
  sort_order INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Try-on sessions table
CREATE TABLE tryon_sessions (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  session_id TEXT NOT NULL, -- Browser session ID for anonymous users
  user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id), -- Optional, for authenticated users
  user_image_url TEXT NOT NULL,
  garment_id UUID REFERENCES garments(id),
  result_image_url TEXT,
  status TEXT DEFAULT 'pending', -- 'pending', 'processing', 'completed', 'failed'
  replicate_prediction_id TEXT,
  error_message TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
  completed_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE
);

-- Create indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX idx_garments_category ON garments(category);
CREATE INDEX idx_garments_featured ON garments(is_featured);
CREATE INDEX idx_sessions_session_id ON tryon_sessions(session_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_sessions_status ON tryon_sessions(status);
```

### 4.2 Storage Buckets

```
Supabase Storage Structure:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ garments/              -- Pre-loaded garment images (public)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tops/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ bottoms/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dresses/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ outerwear/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ user-uploads/          -- User uploaded photos (private)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ {session_id}/
‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ {timestamp}_{filename}
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ results/               -- AI generated results (private)
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ {session_id}/
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ {tryon_session_id}.jpg
```

### 4.3 Row Level Security (RLS) Policies

```sql
-- Garments are publicly readable
CREATE POLICY "Garments are viewable by everyone" 
ON garments FOR SELECT 
USING (true);

-- Users can only see their own sessions
CREATE POLICY "Users can view their own sessions" 
ON tryon_sessions FOR SELECT 
USING (session_id = current_setting('app.session_id', true) OR user_id = auth.uid());

-- Users can create sessions
CREATE POLICY "Anyone can create sessions" 
ON tryon_sessions FOR INSERT 
WITH CHECK (true);
```

---

## 5. UI Design System - Vibrant Youth Style

### 5.1 Color Palette (HSL Format)

```css
:root {
  /* Primary - Vibrant Purple */
  --primary: 270 91% 65%;           /* hsl(270, 91%, 65%) - Electric Purple */
  --primary-foreground: 0 0% 100%;
  
  /* Secondary - Energetic Cyan */
  --secondary: 180 100% 50%;        /* hsl(180, 100%, 50%) - Cyan */
  --secondary-foreground: 0 0% 0%;
  
  /* Accent - Hot Pink */
  --accent: 330 100% 60%;           /* hsl(330, 100%, 60%) - Hot Pink */
  --accent-foreground: 0 0% 100%;
  
  /* Background - Light with subtle warmth */
  --background: 0 0% 100%;
  --foreground: 240 10% 10%;
  
  /* Muted - Soft lavender */
  --muted: 270 30% 95%;
  --muted-foreground: 270 10% 40%;
  
  /* Card - White with subtle purple tint */
  --card: 270 50% 99%;
  --card-foreground: 240 10% 10%;
  
  /* Border - Light purple */
  --border: 270 30% 90%;
  
  /* Ring - Focus state */
  --ring: 270 91% 65%;
  
  /* Success - Fresh Green */
  --success: 150 80% 50%;
  
  /* Warning - Sunny Yellow */
  --warning: 45 100% 55%;
  
  /* Destructive - Coral Red */
  --destructive: 0 80% 60%;
  --destructive-foreground: 0 0% 100%;
  
  /* Radius - Rounded for friendly feel */
  --radius: 1rem;
}
```

### 5.2 Gradient Definitions

```css
/* Primary Gradient - Purple to Pink */
.gradient-primary {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, 
    hsl(270, 91%, 65%) 0%, 
    hsl(330, 100%, 60%) 100%);
}

/* Secondary Gradient - Cyan to Purple */
.gradient-secondary {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, 
    hsl(180, 100%, 50%) 0%, 
    hsl(270, 91%, 65%) 100%);
}

/* Hero Background Gradient */
.gradient-hero {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, 
    hsl(270, 91%, 95%) 0%,
    hsl(330, 100%, 95%) 50%,
    hsl(180, 100%, 95%) 100%);
}

/* Card Hover Gradient */
.gradient-card-hover {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, 
    hsl(270, 50%, 99%) 0%, 
    hsl(330, 50%, 99%) 100%);
}

/* Button Gradient */
.gradient-button {
  background: linear-gradient(90deg, 
    hsl(270, 91%, 65%) 0%, 
    hsl(300, 100%, 60%) 50%,
    hsl(330, 100%, 60%) 100%);
  background-size: 200% 100%;
  transition: background-position 0.3s ease;
}

.gradient-button:hover {
  background-position: 100% 0;
}

/* Animated Background */
@keyframes gradient-shift {
  0%, 100% { background-position: 0% 50%; }
  50% { background-position: 100% 50%; }
}

.gradient-animated {
  background: linear-gradient(-45deg, 
    hsl(270, 91%, 65%),
    hsl(330, 100%, 60%),
    hsl(180, 100%, 50%),
    hsl(270, 91%, 65%));
  background-size: 400% 400%;
  animation: gradient-shift 15s ease infinite;
}
```

### 6.3 Edge Function: tryon-process

```typescript
// supabase/functions/tryon-process/index.ts
import { serve } from "https://deno.land/std@0.168.0/http/server.ts"
import { createClient } from 'https://esm.sh/@supabase/supabase-js@2'

const corsHeaders = {
  'Access-Control-Allow-Origin': '*',
  'Access-Control-Allow-Headers': 'authorization, x-client-info, apikey, content-type',
}

serve(async (req) => {
  // Handle CORS preflight
  if (req.method === 'OPTIONS') {
    return new Response('ok', { headers: corsHeaders })
  }

  try {
    const { userImageUrl, garmentId, sessionId } = await req.json()
    
    // Initialize Supabase client
    const supabase = createClient(
      Deno.env.get('SUPABASE_URL')!,
      Deno.env.get('SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY')!
    )
    
    // Get garment details
    const { data: garment } = await supabase
      .from('garments')
      .select('image_url, category')
      .eq('id', garmentId)
      .single()
    
    // Create session record
    const { data: session } = await supabase
      .from('tryon_sessions')
      .insert({
        session_id: sessionId,
        user_image_url: userImageUrl,
        garment_id: garmentId,
        status: 'processing'
      })
      .select()
      .single()
    
    // Call Replicate API
    const replicateResponse = await fetch(
      'https://api.replicate.com/v1/predictions',
      {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: {
          'Authorization': `Token ${Deno.env.get('REPLICATE_API_TOKEN')}`,
          'Content-Type': 'application/json',
        },
        body: JSON.stringify({
          version: "c871bb9b046c1b1...", // IDM-VTON version
          input: {
            human_img: userImageUrl,
            garm_img: garment.image_url,
            category: garment.category === 'tops' ? 'upper_body' : 
                      garment.category === 'bottoms' ? 'lower_body' : 'full_body'
          },
          webhook: `${Deno.env.get('SUPABASE_URL')}/functions/v1/tryon-webhook`,
          webhook_events_filter: ['completed']
        })
      }
    )
    
    const prediction = await replicateResponse.json()
    
    // Update session with prediction ID
    await supabase
      .from('tryon_sessions')
      .update({ replicate_prediction_id: prediction.id })
      .eq('id', session.id)
    
    return new Response(
      JSON.stringify({ 
        sessionId: session.id,
        predictionId: prediction.id,
        status: 'processing'
      }),
      { headers: { ...corsHeaders, 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } }
    )
    
  } catch (error) {
    return new Response(
      JSON.stringify({ error: error.message }),
      { status: 500, headers: { ...corsHeaders, 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } }
    )
  }
})
```

## 8. Key Implementation Details

### 8.1 File Upload Component Pattern

```typescript
// src/components/upload/UploadZone.tsx
import { useCallback, useState } from 'react'
import { useDropzone } from 'react-dropzone'
import { Upload, Image } from 'lucide-react'
import { cn } from '@/lib/utils'
import { Card } from '@/components/ui/card'
import { Progress } from '@/components/ui/progress'

interface UploadZoneProps {
  onUpload: (file: File) => Promise<void>
  isUploading: boolean
  progress: number
}

export function UploadZone({ onUpload, isUploading, progress }: UploadZoneProps) {
  const onDrop = useCallback((acceptedFiles: File[]) => {
    if (acceptedFiles.length > 0) {
      onUpload(acceptedFiles[0])
    }
  }, [onUpload])

  const { getRootProps, getInputProps, isDragActive } = useDropzone({
    onDrop,
    accept: {
      'image/jpeg': ['.jpg', '.jpeg'],
      'image/png': ['.png'],
      'image/webp': ['.webp']
    },
    maxSize: 10 * 1024 * 1024, // 10MB
    multiple: false
  })

  return (
    <Card
      {...getRootProps()}
      className={cn(
        "relative flex flex-col items-center justify-center p-8 border-2 border-dashed cursor-pointer transition-all duration-300",
        isDragActive 
          ? "border-primary bg-primary/5 scale-[1.02]" 
          : "border-muted-foreground/25 hover:border-primary/50 hover:bg-muted/50",
        isUploading && "pointer-events-none"
      )}
    >
      <input {...getInputProps()} />
      
      {isUploading ? (
        <div className="w-full space-y-4">
          <Progress value={progress} className="h-2" />
          <p className="text-center text-sm text-muted-foreground">
            Uploading... {progress}%
          </p>
        </div>
      ) : (
        <>
          <div className="rounded-full bg-gradient-to-r from-primary to-accent p-4 mb-4">
            <Upload className="h-8 w-8 text-white" />
          </div>
          <p className="text-lg font-medium">
            {isDragActive ? "Drop your photo here" : "Upload your photo"}
          </p>
          <p className="text-sm text-muted-foreground mt-2">
            Drag & drop or click to select
          </p>
          <p className="text-xs text-muted-foreground mt-1">
            JPG, PNG, WebP up to 10MB
          </p>
        </>
      )}
    </Card>
  )
}
```

### 8.2 Zustand Store for Try-On State

```typescript
// src/stores/tryOnStore.ts
import { create } from 'zustand'
import { persist } from 'zustand/middleware'

interface TryOnState {
  // User image
  userImage: string | null
  userImageFile: File | null
  
  // Selected garment
  selectedGarmentId: string | null
  
  // Processing state
  sessionId: string | null
  status: 'idle' | 'uploading' | 'processing' | 'completed' | 'error'
  progress: number
  errorMessage: string | null
  
  // Result
  resultImageUrl: string | null
  
  // Actions
  setUserImage: (url: string, file: File) => void
  setSelectedGarment: (id: string) => void
  setStatus: (status: TryOnState['status']) => void
  setProgress: (progress: number) => void
  setSessionId: (id: string) => void
  setResult: (url: string) => void
  setError: (message: string) => void
  reset: () => void
}

const initialState = {
  userImage: null,
  userImageFile: null,
  selectedGarmentId: null,
  sessionId: null,
  status: 'idle' as const,
  progress: 0,
  errorMessage: null,
  resultImageUrl: null,
}

export const useTryOnStore = create<TryOnState>()(
  persist(
    (set) => ({
      ...initialState,
      
      setUserImage: (url, file) => set({ 
        userImage: url, 
        userImageFile: file,
        status: 'idle' 
      }),
      
      setSelectedGarment: (id) => set({ selectedGarmentId: id }),
      
      setStatus: (status) => set({ status }),
      
      setProgress: (progress) => set({ progress }),
      
      setSessionId: (id) => set({ sessionId: id }),
      
      setResult: (url) => set({ 
        resultImageUrl: url, 
        status: 'completed' 
      }),
      
      setError: (message) => set({ 
        errorMessage: message, 
        status: 'error' 
      }),
      
      reset: () => set(initialState),
    }),
    {
      name: 'tryon-storage',
      partialize: (state) => ({ 
        sessionId: state.sessionId,
        resultImageUrl: state.resultImageUrl 
      }),
    }
  )
)
```

### 8.3 Comparison Slider Component

```typescript
// src/components/result/ComparisonSlider.tsx
import { useState, useRef } from 'react'
import { cn } from '@/lib/utils'

interface ComparisonSliderProps {
  beforeImage: string
  afterImage: string
  beforeLabel?: string
  afterLabel?: string
}

export function ComparisonSlider({ 
  beforeImage, 
  afterImage,
  beforeLabel = "Before",
  afterLabel = "After"
}: ComparisonSliderProps) {
  const [sliderPosition, setSliderPosition] = useState(50)
  const containerRef = useRef<HTMLDivElement>(null)

  const handleMove = (clientX: number) => {
    if (!containerRef.current) return
    
    const rect = containerRef.current.getBoundingClientRect()
    const x = clientX - rect.left
    const percentage = Math.max(0, Math.min(100, (x / rect.width) * 100))
    setSliderPosition(percentage)
  }

  const handleMouseMove = (e: React.MouseEvent) => {
    if (e.buttons !== 1) return
    handleMove(e.clientX)
  }

  const handleTouchMove = (e: React.TouchEvent) => {
    handleMove(e.touches[0].clientX)
  }

  return (
    <div 
      ref={containerRef}
      className="relative w-full aspect-[3/4] overflow-hidden rounded-lg cursor-ew-resize select-none"
      onMouseMove={handleMouseMove}
      onTouchMove={handleTouchMove}
    >
      {/* After Image (Background) */}
      <img 
        src={afterImage} 
        alt={afterLabel}
        className="absolute inset-0 w-full h-full object-cover"
      />
      
      {/* Before Image (Clipped) */}
      <div 
        className="absolute inset-0 overflow-hidden"
        style={{ width: `${sliderPosition}%` }}
      >
        <img 
          src={beforeImage} 
          alt={beforeLabel}
          className="absolute inset-0 w-full h-full object-cover"
          style={{ 
            width: containerRef.current?.clientWidth || '100%',
            maxWidth: 'none'
          }}
        />
      </div>
      
      {/* Slider Line */}
      <div 
        className="absolute top-0 bottom-0 w-1 bg-white shadow-lg cursor-ew-resize"
        style={{ left: `${sliderPosition}%`, transform: 'translateX(-50%)' }}
      >
        {/* Slider Handle */}
        <div className="absolute top-1/2 left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 w-10 h-10 rounded-full bg-white shadow-lg flex items-center justify-center">
          <div className="flex gap-0.5">
            <div className="w-0.5 h-4 bg-gray-400 rounded-full" />
            <div className="w-0.5 h-4 bg-gray-400 rounded-full" />
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      
      {/* Labels */}
      <div className="absolute top-4 left-4 px-2 py-1 bg-black/50 rounded text-white text-sm">
        {beforeLabel}
      </div>
      <div className="absolute top-4 right-4 px-2 py-1 bg-black/50 rounded text-white text-sm">
        {afterLabel}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}
```

---

## 9. Pre-loaded Garment Library Recommendations

**Tops (8-10 items)**
- White T-shirt (basic)

**Outerwear (4-5 items)**

---

## 10. Environment Variables Required

VITE_SUPABASE_URL=https://your-project.supabase.co
VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your-anon-key

SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY=your-service-role-key
REPLICATE_API_TOKEN=your-replicate-token
```

---

## Critical Files for Implementation

### Critical Files for Implementation
- `/app/src/index.css` - Must be updated with the vibrant youth color palette and gradient definitions
- `/app/tailwind.config.ts` - Needs custom animation keyframes and gradient utility classes added

- `/app/src/components/ui/progress.tsx` - Will be used for upload and processing progress indicators

I have gathered enough information about the project structure. Let me now provide a comprehensive implementation plan for the AI virtual try-on (clothing swap) application.

---

# AI Virtual Try-On Application - Complete Implementation Plan

## Executive Summary

This plan outlines the implementation of an AI-powered virtual clothing try-on application built with React 18, Vite, TypeScript, shadcn/ui, and Supabase. The application allows users to upload their photos and virtually try on clothes from a pre-defined garment library using AI processing.

---

## 1. Product Functionality Modules

### 1.1 Welcome/Landing Page
- **Hero section** with animated gradient background
- **Feature highlights** showcasing the app's capabilities
- **Call-to-action button** to start the try-on experience
- **Sample results gallery** to demonstrate quality

### 1.2 Photo Upload Module
- **Drag-and-drop upload zone** with visual feedback
- **Camera capture option** (using browser's getUserMedia API)
- **Image preview** with cropping/adjustment capabilities
- **Image validation** (format, size, resolution checks)
- **Upload progress indicator**

### 1.3 Garment Selection Module
- **Category-based browsing** (tops, bottoms, dresses, outerwear)
- **Grid gallery view** with garment thumbnails
- **Carousel for featured items**
- **Filter and search** functionality
- **Garment detail preview** on hover/click

### 1.4 AI Processing Module
- **Processing status display** with animated progress
- **Estimated time indicator**
- **Error handling** with retry options
- **Queue management** for multiple requests

### 1.5 Results Display Module
- **Before/after comparison slider**
- **Download option** for generated images
- **Share functionality**
- **Try another garment** quick action
- **Quality rating feedback**

### 1.6 History Module (Optional)
- **Session-based history** (no authentication required)
- **Persistent history** (with Supabase authentication)
- **Re-try previous combinations**
- **Delete history entries**

---

## 2. User Interaction Flow

```
[Landing Page]
      |
      v
[Upload Photo] --> [Validate Image] --> [Error: Re-upload]
      |
      v
[Select Garment] --> [Browse Categories] --> [Select Item]
      |
      v
[Confirm Selection] --> [Preview Both Images]
      |
      v
[Process with AI] --> [Show Progress] --> [Handle Errors/Retry]
      |
      v
[Display Result] --> [Download/Share/Try Another]
      |
      v
[History (Optional)] --> [View Past Results]
```

### Detailed Flow Steps:

1. **Entry**: User lands on the welcome page with animated gradient background
2. **Initiation**: User clicks "Start Try-On" button
3. **Photo Upload**: 
   - User drags and drops or clicks to select a photo
   - System validates the image (human figure, proper resolution)
   - Preview shown with optional cropping
4. **Garment Selection**:
   - User browses through garment categories
   - User selects a garment to try on
   - System shows preview of both images side by side
5. **Processing**:
   - User confirms and initiates AI processing
   - Progress indicator shows estimated time
   - System calls Supabase Edge Function which calls AI API
6. **Result**:
   - Generated image displayed with comparison slider
   - User can download, share, or try another garment
7. **History** (if implemented):
   - Results saved to Supabase storage
   - User can view and manage past try-ons

---

## 3. AI Service Recommendation

### Primary Recommendation: Replicate - IDM-VTON

**Model**: `cuuupid/idm-vton` on Replicate

**Why IDM-VTON:**
- State-of-the-art virtual try-on quality
- Supports various clothing types
- Good balance of speed and quality
- Pay-per-use pricing model
- Easy API integration

**API Call Structure:**
```typescript
// Replicate API endpoint
const prediction = await replicate.predictions.create({
  version: "c871bb9b046c1b1-...", // IDM-VTON version
  input: {
    human_img: userPhotoUrl,      // URL to user's uploaded photo
    garm_img: garmentImageUrl,    // URL to garment image
    category: "upper_body",        // Category type
    // Additional parameters for quality tuning
  }
});
```

**Cost Estimation:**
- Approximately $0.02-0.05 per generation
- ~30-60 seconds processing time

### Alternative Options:

1. **Kolors Virtual Try-On (Replicate)**
   - Model: `kolors/virtual-tryon`
   - Good for fashion-forward results

2. **Fashn.AI API**
   - Commercial solution with dedicated support
   - Higher cost but better SLA

3. **Self-hosted Solution**
   - Deploy open-source models on own infrastructure
   - Higher upfront cost, lower per-request cost

---

## 4. Data Storage Architecture (Supabase)

### 4.1 Database Schema

```sql
-- Users table (optional, for authenticated experience)
CREATE TABLE users (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  email TEXT UNIQUE,
  created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Garments table (pre-loaded clothing library)
CREATE TABLE garments (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  name TEXT NOT NULL,
  category TEXT NOT NULL, -- 'tops', 'bottoms', 'dresses', 'outerwear'
  image_url TEXT NOT NULL,
  thumbnail_url TEXT,
  is_featured BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
  sort_order INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Try-on sessions table
CREATE TABLE tryon_sessions (
  id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
  session_id TEXT NOT NULL, -- Browser session ID for anonymous users
  user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id), -- Optional, for authenticated users
  user_image_url TEXT NOT NULL,
  garment_id UUID REFERENCES garments(id),
  result_image_url TEXT,
  status TEXT DEFAULT 'pending', -- 'pending', 'processing', 'completed', 'failed'
  replicate_prediction_id TEXT,
  error_message TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
  completed_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE
);

-- Create indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX idx_garments_category ON garments(category);
CREATE INDEX idx_garments_featured ON garments(is_featured);
CREATE INDEX idx_sessions_session_id ON tryon_sessions(session_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_sessions_status ON tryon_sessions(status);
```

### 4.2 Storage Buckets

```
Supabase Storage Structure:
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ garments/              -- Pre-loaded garment images (public)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tops/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ bottoms/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dresses/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ outerwear/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ user-uploads/          -- User uploaded photos (private)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ {session_id}/
‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ {timestamp}_{filename}
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ results/               -- AI generated results (private)
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ {session_id}/
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ {tryon_session_id}.jpg
```

### 4.3 Row Level Security (RLS) Policies

```sql
-- Garments are publicly readable
CREATE POLICY "Garments are viewable by everyone" 
ON garments FOR SELECT 
USING (true);

-- Users can only see their own sessions
CREATE POLICY "Users can view their own sessions" 
ON tryon_sessions FOR SELECT 
USING (session_id = current_setting('app.session_id', true) OR user_id = auth.uid());

-- Users can create sessions
CREATE POLICY "Anyone can create sessions" 
ON tryon_sessions FOR INSERT 
WITH CHECK (true);
```

---

## 5. UI Design System - Vibrant Youth Style

### 5.1 Color Palette (HSL Format)

```css
:root {
  /* Primary - Vibrant Purple */
  --primary: 270 91% 65%;           /* hsl(270, 91%, 65%) - Electric Purple */
  --primary-foreground: 0 0% 100%;
  
  /* Secondary - Energetic Cyan */
  --secondary: 180 100% 50%;        /* hsl(180, 100%, 50%) - Cyan */
  --secondary-foreground: 0 0% 0%;
  
  /* Accent - Hot Pink */
  --accent: 330 100% 60%;           /* hsl(330, 100%, 60%) - Hot Pink */
  --accent-foreground: 0 0% 100%;
  
  /* Background - Light with subtle warmth */
  --background: 0 0% 100%;
  --foreground: 240 10% 10%;
  
  /* Muted - Soft lavender */
  --muted: 270 30% 95%;
  --muted-foreground: 270 10% 40%;
  
  /* Card - White with subtle purple tint */
  --card: 270 50% 99%;
  --card-foreground: 240 10% 10%;
  
  /* Border - Light purple */
  --border: 270 30% 90%;
  
  /* Ring - Focus state */
  --ring: 270 91% 65%;
  
  /* Success - Fresh Green */
  --success: 150 80% 50%;
  
  /* Warning - Sunny Yellow */
  --warning: 45 100% 55%;
  
  /* Destructive - Coral Red */
  --destructive: 0 80% 60%;
  --destructive-foreground: 0 0% 100%;
  
  /* Radius - Rounded for friendly feel */
  --radius: 1rem;
}
```

### 5.2 Gradient Definitions

```css
/* Primary Gradient - Purple to Pink */
.gradient-primary {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, 
    hsl(270, 91%, 65%) 0%, 
    hsl(330, 100%, 60%) 100%);
}

/* Secondary Gradient - Cyan to Purple */
.gradient-secondary {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, 
    hsl(180, 100%, 50%) 0%, 
    hsl(270, 91%, 65%) 100%);
}

/* Hero Background Gradient */
.gradient-hero {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, 
    hsl(270, 91%, 95%) 0%,
    hsl(330, 100%, 95%) 50%,
    hsl(180, 100%, 95%) 100%);
}

/* Card Hover Gradient */
.gradient-card-hover {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, 
    hsl(270, 50%, 99%) 0%, 
    hsl(330, 50%, 99%) 100%);
}

/* Button Gradient */
.gradient-button {
  background: linear-gradient(90deg, 
    hsl(270, 91%, 65%) 0%, 
    hsl(300, 100%, 60%) 50%,
    hsl(330, 100%, 60%) 100%);
  background-size: 200% 100%;
  transition: background-position 0.3s ease;
}

.gradient-button:hover {
  background-position: 100% 0;
}

/* Animated Background */
@keyframes gradient-shift {
  0%, 100% { background-position: 0% 50%; }
  50% { background-position: 100% 50%; }
}

.gradient-animated {
  background: linear-gradient(-45deg, 
    hsl(270, 91%, 65%),
    hsl(330, 100%, 60%),
    hsl(180, 100%, 50%),
    hsl(270, 91%, 65%));
  background-size: 400% 400%;
  animation: gradient-shift 15s ease infinite;
}
```

### 5.3 Key Page Layouts

### 6.3 Edge Function: tryon-process

```typescript
// supabase/functions/tryon-process/index.ts
import { serve } from "https://deno.land/std@0.168.0/http/server.ts"
import { createClient } from 'https://esm.sh/@supabase/supabase-js@2'

const corsHeaders = {
  'Access-Control-Allow-Origin': '*',
  'Access-Control-Allow-Headers': 'authorization, x-client-info, apikey, content-type',
}

serve(async (req) => {
  // Handle CORS preflight
  if (req.method === 'OPTIONS') {
    return new Response('ok', { headers: corsHeaders })
  }

  try {
    const { userImageUrl, garmentId, sessionId } = await req.json()
    
    // Initialize Supabase client
    const supabase = createClient(
      Deno.env.get('SUPABASE_URL')!,
      Deno.env.get('SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY')!
    )
    
    // Get garment details
    const { data: garment } = await supabase
      .from('garments')
      .select('image_url, category')
      .eq('id', garmentId)
      .single()
    
    // Create session record
    const { data: session } = await supabase
      .from('tryon_sessions')
      .insert({
        session_id: sessionId,
        user_image_url: userImageUrl,
        garment_id: garmentId,
        status: 'processing'
      })
      .select()
      .single()
    
    // Call Replicate API
    const replicateResponse = await fetch(
      'https://api.replicate.com/v1/predictions',
      {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: {
          'Authorization': `Token ${Deno.env.get('REPLICATE_API_TOKEN')}`,
          'Content-Type': 'application/json',
        },
        body: JSON.stringify({
          version: "c871bb9b046c1b1...", // IDM-VTON version
          input: {
            human_img: userImageUrl,
            garm_img: garment.image_url,
            category: garment.category === 'tops' ? 'upper_body' : 
                      garment.category === 'bottoms' ? 'lower_body' : 'full_body'
          },
          webhook: `${Deno.env.get('SUPABASE_URL')}/functions/v1/tryon-webhook`,
          webhook_events_filter: ['completed']
        })
      }
    )
    
    const prediction = await replicateResponse.json()
    
    // Update session with prediction ID
    await supabase
      .from('tryon_sessions')
      .update({ replicate_prediction_id: prediction.id })
      .eq('id', session.id)
    
    return new Response(
      JSON.stringify({ 
        sessionId: session.id,
        predictionId: prediction.id,
        status: 'processing'
      }),
      { headers: { ...corsHeaders, 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } }
    )
    
  } catch (error) {
    return new Response(
      JSON.stringify({ error: error.message }),
      { status: 500, headers: { ...corsHeaders, 'Content-Type': 'application/json' } }
    )
  }
})
```

## 8. Key Implementation Details

### 8.1 File Upload Component Pattern

```typescript
// src/components/upload/UploadZone.tsx
import { useCallback, useState } from 'react'
import { useDropzone } from 'react-dropzone'
import { Upload, Image } from 'lucide-react'
import { cn } from '@/lib/utils'
import { Card } from '@/components/ui/card'
import { Progress } from '@/components/ui/progress'

interface UploadZoneProps {
  onUpload: (file: File) => Promise<void>
  isUploading: boolean
  progress: number
}

export function UploadZone({ onUpload, isUploading, progress }: UploadZoneProps) {
  const onDrop = useCallback((acceptedFiles: File[]) => {
    if (acceptedFiles.length > 0) {
      onUpload(acceptedFiles[0])
    }
  }, [onUpload])

  const { getRootProps, getInputProps, isDragActive } = useDropzone({
    onDrop,
    accept: {
      'image/jpeg': ['.jpg', '.jpeg'],
      'image/png': ['.png'],
      'image/webp': ['.webp']
    },
    maxSize: 10 * 1024 * 1024, // 10MB
    multiple: false
  })

  return (
    <Card
      {...getRootProps()}
      className={cn(
        "relative flex flex-col items-center justify-center p-8 border-2 border-dashed cursor-pointer transition-all duration-300",
        isDragActive 
          ? "border-primary bg-primary/5 scale-[1.02]" 
          : "border-muted-foreground/25 hover:border-primary/50 hover:bg-muted/50",
        isUploading && "pointer-events-none"
      )}
    >
      <input {...getInputProps()} />
      
      {isUploading ? (
        <div className="w-full space-y-4">
          <Progress value={progress} className="h-2" />
          <p className="text-center text-sm text-muted-foreground">
            Uploading... {progress}%
          </p>
        </div>
      ) : (
        <>
          <div className="rounded-full bg-gradient-to-r from-primary to-accent p-4 mb-4">
            <Upload className="h-8 w-8 text-white" />
          </div>
          <p className="text-lg font-medium">
            {isDragActive ? "Drop your photo here" : "Upload your photo"}
          </p>
          <p className="text-sm text-muted-foreground mt-2">
            Drag & drop or click to select
          </p>
          <p className="text-xs text-muted-foreground mt-1">
            JPG, PNG, WebP up to 10MB
          </p>
        </>
      )}
    </Card>
  )
}
```

### 8.2 Zustand Store for Try-On State

```typescript
// src/stores/tryOnStore.ts
import { create } from 'zustand'
import { persist } from 'zustand/middleware'

interface TryOnState {
  // User image
  userImage: string | null
  userImageFile: File | null
  
  // Selected garment
  selectedGarmentId: string | null
  
  // Processing state
  sessionId: string | null
  status: 'idle' | 'uploading' | 'processing' | 'completed' | 'error'
  progress: number
  errorMessage: string | null
  
  // Result
  resultImageUrl: string | null
  
  // Actions
  setUserImage: (url: string, file: File) => void
  setSelectedGarment: (id: string) => void
  setStatus: (status: TryOnState['status']) => void
  setProgress: (progress: number) => void
  setSessionId: (id: string) => void
  setResult: (url: string) => void
  setError: (message: string) => void
  reset: () => void
}

const initialState = {
  userImage: null,
  userImageFile: null,
  selectedGarmentId: null,
  sessionId: null,
  status: 'idle' as const,
  progress: 0,
  errorMessage: null,
  resultImageUrl: null,
}

export const useTryOnStore = create<TryOnState>()(
  persist(
    (set) => ({
      ...initialState,
      
      setUserImage: (url, file) => set({ 
        userImage: url, 
        userImageFile: file,
        status: 'idle' 
      }),
      
      setSelectedGarment: (id) => set({ selectedGarmentId: id }),
      
      setStatus: (status) => set({ status }),
      
      setProgress: (progress) => set({ progress }),
      
      setSessionId: (id) => set({ sessionId: id }),
      
      setResult: (url) => set({ 
        resultImageUrl: url, 
        status: 'completed' 
      }),
      
      setError: (message) => set({ 
        errorMessage: message, 
        status: 'error' 
      }),
      
      reset: () => set(initialState),
    }),
    {
      name: 'tryon-storage',
      partialize: (state) => ({ 
        sessionId: state.sessionId,
        resultImageUrl: state.resultImageUrl 
      }),
    }
  )
)
```

### 8.3 Comparison Slider Component

```typescript
// src/components/result/ComparisonSlider.tsx
import { useState, useRef } from 'react'
import { cn } from '@/lib/utils'

interface ComparisonSliderProps {
  beforeImage: string
  afterImage: string
  beforeLabel?: string
  afterLabel?: string
}

export function ComparisonSlider({ 
  beforeImage, 
  afterImage,
  beforeLabel = "Before",
  afterLabel = "After"
}: ComparisonSliderProps) {
  const [sliderPosition, setSliderPosition] = useState(50)
  const containerRef = useRef<HTMLDivElement>(null)

  const handleMove = (clientX: number) => {
    if (!containerRef.current) return
    
    const rect = containerRef.current.getBoundingClientRect()
    const x = clientX - rect.left
    const percentage = Math.max(0, Math.min(100, (x / rect.width) * 100))
    setSliderPosition(percentage)
  }

  const handleMouseMove = (e: React.MouseEvent) => {
    if (e.buttons !== 1) return
    handleMove(e.clientX)
  }

  const handleTouchMove = (e: React.TouchEvent) => {
    handleMove(e.touches[0].clientX)
  }

  return (
    <div 
      ref={containerRef}
      className="relative w-full aspect-[3/4] overflow-hidden rounded-lg cursor-ew-resize select-none"
      onMouseMove={handleMouseMove}
      onTouchMove={handleTouchMove}
    >
      {/* After Image (Background) */}
      <img 
        src={afterImage} 
        alt={afterLabel}
        className="absolute inset-0 w-full h-full object-cover"
      />
      
      {/* Before Image (Clipped) */}
      <div 
        className="absolute inset-0 overflow-hidden"
        style={{ width: `${sliderPosition}%` }}
      >
        <img 
          src={beforeImage} 
          alt={beforeLabel}
          className="absolute inset-0 w-full h-full object-cover"
          style={{ 
            width: containerRef.current?.clientWidth || '100%',
            maxWidth: 'none'
          }}
        />
      </div>
      
      {/* Slider Line */}
      <div 
        className="absolute top-0 bottom-0 w-1 bg-white shadow-lg cursor-ew-resize"
        style={{ left: `${sliderPosition}%`, transform: 'translateX(-50%)' }}
      >
        {/* Slider Handle */}
        <div className="absolute top-1/2 left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 w-10 h-10 rounded-full bg-white shadow-lg flex items-center justify-center">
          <div className="flex gap-0.5">
            <div className="w-0.5 h-4 bg-gray-400 rounded-full" />
            <div className="w-0.5 h-4 bg-gray-400 rounded-full" />
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      
      {/* Labels */}
      <div className="absolute top-4 left-4 px-2 py-1 bg-black/50 rounded text-white text-sm">
        {beforeLabel}
      </div>
      <div className="absolute top-4 right-4 px-2 py-1 bg-black/50 rounded text-white text-sm">
        {afterLabel}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}
```
